features: Professional-level results at home: transform your traditional ironing routine into a professional experience with Rowenta Perfect Steam Pro, delivering an unbelievable steam output thanks to its unique built-in boiler technology

Professional results faster: Cut your ironing time by half with the high-pressure steam, deeply penetrating the fabrics. Precisely and evenly distributed through the 400 holes of the Microsteam Soleplate, it efficiently removes tough unwanted creases
Large water capacity for extended use: unlike a traditional iron, the 1.1L water tank is way bigger but also removable for easy refills and uninterrupted ironing sessions

Lightweight and Maneuverable: unlike your traditional iron, discover the lightweight design of this iron, making it so easy to handle and maneuver during your ironing and crafting sessions. Glide smoothly over any type of fabric, ensuring gentle pressing
Durable Companion: Experience peace of mind with the Perfect Steam Pro's leak-proof design and calc collector: no more worries about water leakage or accidental stains. Performance made to last
body.description: Elevate your ironing to pro-level with Rowenta's Perfect Steam Pro Steam Generator and its game-changing high-pressure boiler technology. It consistently delivers exceptional steam power instantly and on demand, with an outstanding 430g/min steam boost. The Microsteam soleplate, with its 400 active micro-holes, provides a precise and even steam distribution to tackle the toughest unwanted creases. Unlike your traditional iron, your steam generator features a generous and removable 37-oz watertank for longer uninterrupted ironing, as well as a lighter iron for smooth and effortless gliding. Crafted with high quality standards, it also features a calc collector, ensuring long lasting performance and full care of your fabrics.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars AMAZING! Cut my ironing 3/4 the time
reviews.reviewText: Rowenta Perfect Pro Steam Station for Clothes. DG8624 1800 Watts(Dark blue handle and dark blue tank)Stainless Steel Soleplate and interior tank, 1.1 Liter Capacity Removable Tank, Iron- SteamerI DISCOVERED THE WATER FILL LINE is actually the bottom of the indented handle-- POUR (1.1 liters) 4.5CUPS OF WATER INTO THE EMPTY TANK--how clever--you will see what I mean--but it is difficult to see the water level through the dark blue plastic.AMAZING! Cut your ironing to 3/4 the time. I loved my regular type, top of line Rowenta iron (that stays on instead of keep shutting off) and --then I dropped it on tile floor and the plastic water container cracked. To replace it would be around $100. I researched irons and discovered the steam station--It has been so worth it even though it costs a bit more. It is amazing because1) it heats up fast2) the motor is not disturbing-- is NOT loud: (THE QUIET MOTOR only turns on when you press the steam button--and runs about 5 seconds every once in awhile ) (I can iron for hours with toddler taking naps 6 feet away in the same room(The Motor: I have only used regular irons and didn’t know that steam systems (with table top tanks) without the “motor” have to be placed higher than the iron so the water flows). BE GRATEFUL FOR THE MOTOR!3) the INTERIOR STAINLESS STEEL PARTS of the tank takes 1 liter of TAP WATER: --fill anytime while ironing--do not use distilled water (or 1/2 of regular and distilled--to use up your extra supply of distilled jugs)4) a light comes on when a simple calcium cleaning needs to be done (watch Youtube video)5) the STEAM PLATE is fantastic with so many holes--when you press the steam button--a flood of hot mist comes out--no drips, in one second creases in fabric disappear-and the steam button you push is so lightly sprung-your finger never gets tired pushing the button (which was a complaint with a different iron I used to have)6) the unit is NOT BULKY--it seems like it would be--but the whole unit is easy to lift up to store or move--if you have a laundry room closet--you could literally keep the unit in the closet, pull up your ironing board and iron right there or on the counter and not move the iron base unit at all. THE STEAM CORD IS VERY LONG AND CONVENIENT.7) the iron itself IS SO LIGHTWEIGHT and streamline--you aren’t pushing and lifting a heavy, bulky iron equipped with a water tank and heating element parts.8) if you love yourself and love your time--try out this steam systemYoutube: watch the few videos about this steam iron system: (the very hard to find) sole plate accessory is recommended: Rowenta ZD7900D1 - ironing accessories

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent product, excellent warranty
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the Rowenta Steam Station to replace an earlier version because it has an excellent shot of steam, it holds a lot of water and because it stays on for 30 minutes before the auto shut off kicks in. This is important for sewers. It does go on standby after 8 minutes, but quickly revives itself with a push of a button. It is important to clean the calcium collector frequently if you have hard water--which is how I ruined the earlier one. After five months, the shot of steam stopped working consistently. I contacted the warranty department by email and after several emails verifying my purchase, I was issued a case number. I then called the warranty department with the case number and they emailed a UPS prepaid label to me. I packed it up and sent it to a repair shop on a Monday and received a repaired iron back about a week and a half later. I was shocked it took so little time. The iron works perfectly again. Very pleased with this product and the prompt repair.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Steam Station
reviews.reviewText: The Rowenta Perfect Steam Pro with a stainless steel soleplate is an excellent solution if you're in need of a steam station. It's quite sizable, so make sure you have the space, but it does an outstanding job with ironing.The professional steam capabilities make it efficient for various fabrics. If you have the room for it, this steam station is a great investment for achieving crisp and well-ironed clothes. Highly recommended for those in search of a reliable and effective ironing solution!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I’m pleased with the setup. It is a strong steam iron, holds enough water to press for a while. Works great in my sewing room.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars HIGHLY recommend- if you’re one of the few of us that still iron!
reviews.reviewText: I cannot say enough good things about this iron. To start off, I am someone that does iron a good bit on a weekly basis (I’m the person that still irons their bedsheets lol) and this is a HUGE upgrade to my old iron. I used a Rowenta steam iron for years until I tried to DIY deep clean it and ruined it (helpful hint: never put red wine vinegar in as a replacement to distilled white vinegar…not the same haha). This iron steams like NO OTHER- it’s got some power! What’s nice is the steam doesn’t ever squirt water, it’s all steam all the time. Takes a couple mins to heat up but once it’s warm, it’s ready to go. Easy to move around with the base attachment and feels very well built, like all other Rowenta products.Highly recommend this if you’re on the hunt for an iron with some power and want to make your ironing even faster!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far, I love thus iron!
reviews.reviewText: This iron sits on the end of my ironing board where I used to put starch, scissors etc. Easy on/off. Easy fill - and less filling! I haven't had to clean the caulk out yet but that also looks very easy. I iron everything from dish towels to king-sized bed sheets. The steam from this makes it so much easier! And if you accidentally put a crease where you don't want it; you can get it right out! This iron is amazing! I bought the 3 year warranty because I've had trouble in the past with seals in Rowenta irons. But even so, this iron should never spit water all over your clothes because the water tank NOT in the iron. I'm hoping for a long, happy future!
Creo que esta es una de las mejores compras que he hecho en mí vida.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast heating, powerful steam, great results.
reviews.reviewText: We had to replace the one we had for more than 10 years, my fault because I dropped it badly enough, it could not get repaired. So we replaced it. Easier way to fill the water, fast heating and strong steam makes it easy to iron.And it is true, we save time.We are both very satisfied with our purchase and would not hesitate to recommend itGreat product
